ARABIC: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا۟ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Equally, no Messenger came to those before them without their saying, 'A magician or a madman!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Even thus no apostle came to those before them but they said: "He is a sorcerer or a mad man."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thus has it been (in the past): never did a Messenger come to the nations that preceded them but they said: “(He is) a sorcerer, or a mad-man.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In the same way no Messenger came to those who lived before them without his people calling him a magician or an insane person.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Similarly, whenever a Noble Messenger came to those before them they always said, “He is a magician or a madman.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them but they said: "A sorcerer or a madman!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Thus there did not come to those before them an apostle but they said: A magician or a mad man.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Even so not a Messenger came to those before them but they said, 'A sorcerer, or a man possessed!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Even so there came no messenger unto those before them but they said: A wizard or a madman!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Likewise, there came no messenger to those before them, but they said, "He is a sorcerer or a madman."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Likewise, there came not an apostle Unto those before them but they said: a magician or a madman!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So it was that there did not come any apostle to those who were before them but they said, ‘A magician,’ or ‘A crazy man!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Similarly, no messenger came to the Peoples before them, but they said (of him) in like manner, "A sorcerer, or one possessed"!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them, but they said: "A sorcerer or a madman!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Similarly, no Messenger came to those before them but they said: 'Sorcerer, or mad'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them, but they said, “A sorcerer or a madman.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:52] Thus there did not come to those who were before them any messenger but they said, that he was: ‘A sorcerer, or a madman!’, in other words, their denial of you, by saying that you are a sorcerer or a madman, was like the denial of communities before them of their messengers by saying that [same thing].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Even so) just as your own people accused you of being a wizard and madman (there came no messenger) calling to Allah (unto those before them) before your people (but they said) to that messenger: (A wizard or a madman!
